{"id":1265371137,"question_id":2696,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"3Â weeks","timestamp":1716432623,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"847 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1265371137/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"The Number of Beautiful Subsets","memory":"254.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\n\n    public int beautifulSubsets(int[] nums, int k) {\n        \n        Arrays.sort(nums);\n        \n        List<List<Integer>> res= new ArrayList<>();\n        helper(nums, 0, new ArrayList<>(), res, k);\n\n        return res.size();\n    }\n\n    private void helper(int[] nums, int idx, List<Integer> curr, List<List<Integer>> res, int k){\n\n        if(!curr.isEmpty()){\n            res.add(new ArrayList<>(curr));\n        }\n\n        for(int i=idx; i<nums.length; i++){\n            if(curr.isEmpty() || !curr.contains(nums[i]-k)){\n                curr.add(nums[i]);\n                helper(nums, i+1, curr, res, k);\n                curr.remove(curr.size()-1);\n            }\n        }\n\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"the-number-of-beautiful-subsets","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
